general: Use 'Playfair Display' for all H1-H3 headings to establish the premium feel.
Use 'Rajdhani' for all monetary values, odds, and timers.
Ensure all backgrounds are #050505 or darker. NEVER use pure black #000000 for cards, only for the main page background.
Use the 'Gold Gradient' for primary actions (Deposit, Play Now).
Implement 'Glassmorphism' for the mobile navigation bar and modal overlays.
Use 'Framer Motion' for page transitions (fade in/slide up).
For Payment Methods (JazzCash/Easypaisa), create custom cards using Lucide icons with their respective brand colors if logos are missing.

specific_pages.landing: Hero section must use the 'hero_bg' image with a heavy dark overlay (bg-black/70) so text pops. Headline text must be Gold Gradient.
specific_pages.dashboard: Use the Bento Grid layout. Stat cards should be glassmorphic. Wallet balance must be large and use the Rajdhani font.
specific_pages.game_lobby: Grid of game cards. Hovering a card should scale it up slightly and reveal a 'Play' button.
specific_pages.wallet: Transaction history should look like a high-end fintech app (clean rows, subtle dividers).
specific_pages.admin: Keep it cleaner than the user app, but maintain the dark theme. Use high-contrast charts.

universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
